stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on finishing shaders and visual polish for the first overworld zone (bunny-burrow mountain, surrounding beach and lighthouse) so he can send a beta build to a single tester. He experiments with plant textures, cave and volcano materials, and begins a reflective shader for the lighthouse while fighting Fast64 export bugs.

development_findings.summary: Main goal of the session is to complete base shaders for the overworld’s first section (plants, cave, volcano, lighthouse) so a beta ROM can be sent to testers.
development_findings.quote: "I think today we can finish the shaders in this part of the overworld and move on… I wanna get this ready for beta testing."

development_findings.summary: Visual direction: overworld must feel like a believable place, not a menu, so there will be no Banjo-style level nameplates and the entrance is made welcoming with flowers, roots and carrots.
development_findings.quote: "I want this to feel placey… not gamey."

development_findings.summary: Entrance design: a friendly flower-covered burrow is deliberately blocked by a Pachyderm NPC who demands 10 coins or can be flipped with a ground-pound, creating playful tension.
development_findings.quote: "They want me to go here, but this asshole won’t let me."

development_findings.summary: Implemented cutscene-skip plan: holding A shows a fast-forward icon that fills for ~30 frames; releasing early cancels, holding long enough exits the scene. Zeina is preparing the UI asset.
development_findings.quote: "I wanna add a functionality to skip cutscenes… hold A and a Breath-of-the-Wild circle fills."

development_findings.summary: ROM size is capped at exactly 64 MB; Kaze rejects bigger carts or extra chips to stay authentic to N64 limits.
development_findings.quote: "The final ROM is probably going to be exactly 64 megabytes."

development_findings.summary: New reflective combiner planned for lighthouse (metal bands) using an RGB texture and separate alpha mask, inspired by a test building made with Akumoid.
Fast64 exporter currently mangles alpha/colour, turning lighthouse stripes yellow; Kaze will debug the issue upstream before next stream.
development_findings.quote: "Something really fucked is going on here… I will have to debug this upstream."

development_findings.summary: Ship level uses true 3-D rain in world space; Kaze praises matrix animations over CPU-skinned meshes for speed and criticises modern engines for ignoring them.
Considering buying the original Mario 64 sample libraries so the Return to Yoshi’s Island soundtrack could legally be sold.
development_findings.quote: "What if at some point I wanna sell the RTYI OST."

context_findings.summary: Kaze balances the hack with a full-time Unreal 5 job, YouTube channel, sponsors, and caring for his child, limiting daily dev time.
context_findings.quote: "Development was a lot faster before I had a job… and I also have to make YouTube videos."

context_findings.summary: He is debating a gambling sponsorship to finance videos but fears community backlash.
context_findings.quote: "How mad would you be at me if I took a gambling sponsorship on YouTube?"

context_findings.summary: Philosophy: players often ask for features they later dislike (e.g., Minecraft phantoms), so he designs with cautious restraint.
context_findings.quote: "This is why you don't give players what they want, because players have no idea what the consequences are."

context_findings.summary: Personal stance on authenticity: exceeding original hardware (extra storage or chips) would feel like cheating and erode the N64 identity.
Invests in stock market, equates it to gambling, illustrating his pragmatic view on risk and funding.
context_findings.quote: "Honestly, I am a gambler… even now I am still invested in the stock market."

biobak.summary: Will rework many placeholder textures and shaders after Kaze’s pass; Kaze frequently defers precise colour/plant work to him.
biobak.quote: "Biobak is gonna rework some of this anyway."

biobak.summary: Recently showed Kaze a vine texture that may be reused for the cave/plants.

zeina.summary: Tasked with creating the skip-cutscene UI/button; Kaze checks on her progress during stream.
zeina.quote: "Zeina, did you end up making the skip button?"

key_stories.title: Inviting Burrow, Obstructive Pachyderm
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants the bunny burrow entrance to feel warm and festive with flowers and carrots, but immediately blocks it with a Pachyderm NPC who demands payment or a ground-pound flip. The contrast is designed to increase player curiosity and agency.
key_stories.challenge: Create an overworld gate that feels welcoming yet unavailable.
key_stories.process: Iterated on plant textures, vertex colours and placement; decided on coin toll or physical flip interaction.
key_stories.outcome: Visual pass completed; mechanic concept locked for implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: They want me to go here, but this asshole won't let me.

key_stories.title: Cutscene Skip Mechanic
key_stories.summary: Community wants skippable story scenes. Kaze outlines a hold-A quick-fill UI inspired by Breath of the Wild and assigns Zeina the button artwork.
key_stories.challenge: Add skipping while preventing accidental presses.
key_stories.process: Design hold-A radial timer, discuss depleting when released, assign UI asset to Zeina.
key_stories.key_quote: Hold A and a widget appears… once you hold A for 30 frames the cutscene just stops.

key_stories.title: Lighthouse Reflection Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze tries to replicate a metallic reflection shader from another level for the lighthouse’s red-white stripes. Fast64 exports corrupt the combiner, turning textures yellow and adding patterns.
key_stories.challenge: Implement complex combiner within plugin limits.
key_stories.process: Separated colour and alpha masks, tested in-game, diagnosed exporter multiplying alpha incorrectly.
key_stories.outcome: Bug logged for upstream debugging; shader postponed.
key_stories.key_quote: Something really fucked is going on here… the plugin exported my texture wrong.
